intro: Packera ganderi, commonly known as Gander's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Packera ganderi is often found in open meadows and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
